channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Australians head to the polls Saturday in election overshadowed by Trump
item.description: Australia heads to the polls on Saturday in an election overshadowed by President Trump. Will concerns over Trump's policies drive an outcome similar to what happened in Canada's elections?

item.title: House budget bill should preserve Medicaid's 'original purpose,' says Rep. Jeff Hurd
item.description: Medicaid cuts loom over House Republicans' budget reconciliation. Rep. Jeff Hurd, R-Colo. says the "right reforms," like work requirements and stopping "improper" spending, could save money.

item.title: Trump sending national security adviser Mike Waltz to the UN in White House shakeup
item.description: Mike Waltz is out as national security adviser in the first big shakeup in White House staff since Trump started his second term. Trump will nominate Waltz to serve as ambassador to the UN.

item.title: Shein and Temu will cost more, thanks to massive tariffs going into effect
item.description: Shein and Temu goods might not be so cheap anymore. Starting today, the U.S. will start collecting import fees on small packages from China, much of which comes from Chinese e-commerce sites.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump orders end to federal funding for NPR and PBS, Mike Waltz out as national security adviser, federal judge blocks use of Alien Enemies Act to deport Venezuelans in South Texas.

item.title: Singer Ledisi talks about her new album 'The Crown'
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with singer Ledisi about her new album "The Crown."

item.title: How tariffs might impact small American winemakers
item.description: President Trump's new tariffs could help the American wine industry by making wines from abroad more expensive. But some smaller American winemakers aren't feeling as positive about them.

item.title: New financial pressures forcing Planned Parenthood to close some clinics
item.description: Planned Parenthood is closing some clinics that offer abortions, even in states where abortion has broad protections, due to new financial pressures.

item.title: How a group of older harmonica-playing Korean women has captivated LA hockey fans
item.description: A group of women harmonica players from the Koreatown Senior and Community Center have been performing the national anthem before Los Angeles Kings playoff games and winning over hockey fans.

item.title: President Trump orders end to federal funding for NPR and PBS
item.description: President Trump signed an executive order Thursday directing the Corporation for Public Broadcasting's board of directors to "cease federal funding for NPR and PBS."
